channel.title: Packets and frames
channel.description:
Open a deob 317 client.java
Packets: To find the packet use find and type (byte)6, *packet id here*
Then for example te dropping items one will look like this:
[code] if(l == 847) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 87); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, i1); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method399(k); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, j); anInt1243 = 0; anInt1244 = k; anInt1245 = j; anInt1246 = 2; if(Class9.aClass9Array210[k].anInt236 == anInt857) anInt1246 = 1; if(Class9.aClass9Array210[k].anInt236 == anInt1276) anInt1246 = 3; }[/code]
The l is the button, and I'll show you what these are: [code] aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 87); // packet id aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, i1); // read value aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method399(k); // read value aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, j); // read value [/code] Then we use Kevin's method list to work out each read value
First Id: readUnsignedWordA Second Id: readUnsignedWord Third Id: readUnsignedWordA
Frames: To find a frame either type anInt1008 == *frameid* or j == *frameid*
j frames are usually objects, npcs, items etc. anint1008 frames are misc
Lets decode frame 85 (the object frame, used for items and objects)
[code] if(anInt1008 == 85) { anInt1269 = aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1083.method427(false); anInt1268 = aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1083.method427(false); anInt1008 = -1; return true; } [/code] Now using Kevins method list we work out the ids
First Id: writeByteC Second Id: writeByteC
So to use this frame we'd put:
[code] outStream.createFrame(85); outStream.writeByteC(currentX); // it's x coord lol outStream.writeByteC(currentY); // it's y coord lol [/code]
Hope this helps you all :) enjoy lol
Kevins method list:
[code]! Reading ! method398 = readUnsignedByte method399 = readUnsignedWord method405 = readString method424 = readSignedByteC method431 = readSignedWordBigEndian method432 = readUnsignedWordA method433 = readUnsignedWordBigEndianA method441 = readBytes_reverseA
method402 = readDWord (long)method402 = readQWord
! Writing ! method408 = writeByte method410 = writeWord method413 = writeDWord method414 = writeQWord method415 = writeString method426 = writeByteS OR A method427 = writeByteC method428 = writeByteA OR S method434 = writeWordBigEndian method434 = writeWordBigEndian_dup method435 = writeWordA method436 = writeWordBigEndianA method439 = writeDWord_v2 method440 = writeDWord_v2 method442 = writeBytes_reverse
method409 = writeByte method411 = writeWord method437 = writeWordBigEndian method438 = writeWordBigEndianA method430 = writeByteA method429 = writeByte[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: April 20, 2006, 05:05:46 am[/size][hr]Lol guess not many people like this huh, it's useful :D :$ lolololololol XD

item.title: Packets and frames
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

Open a deob 317 client.java

Packets:
To find the packet use find and type (byte)6, packet id here

Then for example te dropping items one will look like this:

if(l == 847) { aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 87); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, i1); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method399(k); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, j); anInt1243 = 0; anInt1244 = k; anInt1245 = j; anInt1246 = 2; if(Class9.aClass9Array210[k].anInt236 == anInt857) anInt1246 = 1; if(Class9.aClass9Array210[k].anInt236 == anInt1276) anInt1246 = 3; }

The l is the button, and I’ll show you what these are:

            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 87); // packet id
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, i1); // read value
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method399(k); // read value
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method432( -431, j); // read value

Then we use Kevin’s method list to work out each read value

First Id: readUnsignedWordA
Second Id: readUnsignedWord
Third Id: readUnsignedWordA

Frames:
To find a frame either type anInt1008 == frameid or j == frameid

j frames are usually objects, npcs, items etc.
anint1008 frames are misc

Lets decode frame 85 (the object frame, used for items and objects)

            if(anInt1008 == 85)
            {
                anInt1269 = aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1083.method427(false);
                anInt1268 = aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1083.method427(false);
                anInt1008 = -1;
                return true;
            }

Now using Kevins method list we work out the ids

First Id: writeByteC
Second Id: writeByteC

So to use this frame we’d put:

outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(currentX); // it's x coord lol
outStream.writeByteC(currentY); // it's y coord lol

Hope this helps you all enjoy lol

Kevins method list:

[code]! Reading !
method398 = readUnsignedByte
method399 = readUnsignedWord
method405 = readString
method424 = readSignedByteC
method431 = readSignedWordBigEndian
method432 = readUnsignedWordA
method433 = readUnsignedWordBigEndianA
method441 = readBytes_reverseA

method402 = readDWord
(long)method402 = readQWord

! Writing !
method408 = writeByte
method410 = writeWord
method413 = writeDWord
method414 = writeQWord
method415 = writeString
method426 = writeByteS OR A
method427 = writeByteC
method428 = writeByteA OR S
method434 = writeWordBigEndian
method434 = writeWordBigEndian_dup
method435 = writeWordA
method436 = writeWordBigEndianA
method439 = writeDWord_v2
method440 = writeDWord_v2
method442 = writeBytes_reverse

method409 = writeByte
method411 = writeWord
method437 = writeWordBigEndian
method438 = writeWordBigEndianA
method430 = writeByteA
method429 = writeByte[/code][br][size=1]Posted at: April 20, 2006, 05:05:46 am[/size][hr]Lol guess not many people like this huh, it’s useful lolololololol XD

Read full topic
